Container.Name: ONLYOFFICE-Mail-Official
Container.Overview:
Official ONLYOFFICE Mail Server container.
To ensure the mail delivery to internal addresses as well as addresses of external servers you need to get your own domain name and configure a DNS server.
The following DNS records are required:
- A record (used to point a domain to the IP address of the host where this docker image is deployed). - Pointer (RTP) record or a reverse DNS record (used to map a network interface (IP) to a hostname).
Container.DonateText: If you like my work and would like to support me please consider Donating.
Container.Requires:
#Before you start this Docker the first time
Please edit the "Extra Parameters" and change the "-h yourdomain.com" to your domain name! Be sure, that your domain is pointing to your server.

Config.Name: SMTP_TCP_PORT
Config.Description: 25: SMTP - The default port for the Simple Mail Transfer Protocol, used to transfer email messages from source to destination between mail servers and used by end users to send email to a mail system.

Config.Name: IMAP_STARTTLS_TCP_PORT
Config.Description: 143: IMAP STARTTLS - The default port for the Internet Message Access Protocol using STARTTLS connection, which is used to retrieve email messages from the server without the need to download them to the client; if STARTTLS connection is not available an insecure connection will be used.

Config.Name: SMTP_STARTTLS_TCP_PORT
Config.Description: 587: SMTP STARTTLS - The default port for the Simple Mail Transfer Protocol Secure, used to transfer email messages from source to destination between the mail servers and used by end users to send email to a mail system via secure connection using TLS.
